revised_title: Neurotrophins and Sensory Neurons: Role in Development, Maintenance, and Injury
tldr: The article discusses the role of neurotrophins in the development of neural crest cells that become sensory ganglia. It explores the regulation of cell number and identity, as well as the influence of the neural tube and mesodermal cells on the proliferation, survival, and differentiation of prospective dorsal root ganglia cells. The study also highlights the importance of BDNF, NT-3, and basic FGF in mediating this environmental signaling.
